Able to feel or perceive.
Liable to external impression; easily affected; sensitive.
definitions.example: a sensible thermometer

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to the senses; sensory.
Cognizant; having the perception of something; aware of something.
Acting with or showing good sense; able to make good judgements based on reason.
Characterized more by usefulness or practicality than by fashionableness, especially of clothing.
Prohibited; not permitted by law (either civil or criminal law; see illegal).
definitions.example: He was charged with unlawful use of a car.

definitions.definition: To reduce the force of something; to abate.
To restrain, usually with the sense of being in anticipation
(sometimes figurative) To cut off, remove, take away.
To leave out, except, bar.
To waste away.
To deprive of.
To lessen by retrenching, deducting, or reducing; to abate; to beat down; to lower.
To allow by way of abatement or deduction.
To contend or strive with blows or arguments.
Of a falcon: To flap the wings vigorously; to bait.
To soak leather so as to remove chemicals used in tanning; to steep in bate.
To masturbate.
definitions.example: I could go out and take a walk in the park, but I'd rather stay home and bate all day.

definitions.definition: To include (something) as a part.
definitions.example: The design of his house incorporates a spiral staircase.

definitions.definition: To mix (something in) as an ingredient; to blend
definitions.example: Incorporate air into the mixture.

definitions.definition: To admit as a member of a company
To form into a legal company.
definitions.example: The company was incorporated in 1980.

definitions.definition: To include (another clause or guarantee of the US constitution) as a part (of the Fourteenth Amendment, such that the clause binds not only the federal government but also state governments).
To form into a body; to combine, as different ingredients, into one consistent mass.
To unite with a material body; to give a material form to; to embody.
The silken structure which a spider builds using silk secreted from the spinnerets at the caudal tip of its abdomen; a spiderweb.
definitions.example: The sunlight glistened in the dew on the web.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Any interconnected set of persons, places, or things, which when diagrammed resembles a spider's web.
(sometimes capitalized) Specifically, the World Wide Web.
definitions.example: Let me search the web for that.

definitions.definition: The part of a baseball mitt between the forefinger and thumb, the webbing.
definitions.example: He caught the ball in the web.

definitions.definition: A latticed or woven structure.
definitions.example: The gazebo's roof was a web made of thin strips of wood.

definitions.definition: (usually with "spin", "weave", or similar verbs) A tall tale with more complexity than a myth or legend.
definitions.example: Careful—she knows how to spin a good web, but don't lean too hard on what she says.

definitions.definition: A plot or scheme.
The interconnection between flanges in structural members, increasing the effective lever arm and so the load capacity of the member.
The thinner vertical section of a railway rail between the top (head) and bottom (foot) of the rail.
A fold of tissue connecting the toes of certain birds, or of other animals.
The series of barbs implanted on each side of the shaft of a feather, whether stiff and united together by barbules, as in ordinary feathers, or soft and separate, as in downy feathers.
A continuous strip of material carried by rollers during processing.
(lithography) A long sheet of paper which is fed from a roll into a printing press, as opposed to individual sheets of paper.
A band of webbing used to regulate the extension of the hood of a carriage.
A thin metal sheet, plate, or strip, as of lead.
A major broadcasting network.
To construct or form a web.
To cover with a web or network.
To ensnare or entangle.
To provide with a web.
To weave.
To rotate about an off-centre fixed point.
definitions.example: The plant swung in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To dance.
To ride on a swing.
definitions.example: The children laughed as they swung.

definitions.definition: To participate in the swinging lifestyle; to participate in wife-swapping.
To hang from the gallows.
(of a ball) to move sideways in its trajectory.
To fluctuate or change.
definitions.example: It wasn't long before the crowd's mood swung towards restless irritability.

definitions.definition: To move (an object) backward and forward; to wave.
definitions.example: He swung his sword as hard as he could.

definitions.definition: To change (a numerical result); especially to change the outcome of an election.
To make (something) work; especially to afford (something) financially.
definitions.example: If it’s not too expensive, I think we can swing it.

definitions.definition: To play notes that are in pairs by making the first of the pair slightly longer than written (augmentation) and the second shorter, resulting in a bouncy, uneven rhythm.
(of a bowler) to make the ball move sideways in its trajectory.
To move one's arm in a punching motion.
In dancing, to turn around in a small circle with one's partner, holding hands or arms.
definitions.example: "to swing one's partner", or simply "to swing"

definitions.definition: To admit or turn something for the purpose of shaping it; said of a lathe.
definitions.example: The lathe can swing a pulley of 12 inches diameter.

definitions.definition: To put (a door, gate, etc.) on hinges so that it can swing or turn.
To turn round by action of wind or tide when at anchor.
definitions.example: A ship swings with the tide.

definitions.definition: Huge, immense.
Heavy, powerful, scathing.
definitions.example: a swingeing verbal attack

definitions.definition: Fine, good, successful.
definitions.example: The party was swinging.

definitions.definition: The act or motion of that which swings.
An activity where couples engage in sexual activity with different partners.
